newsitem.title: QATAR: Qatar, Phillips in $750 mln petrochem j.v..
newsitem.headline: Qatar, Phillips in $750 mln petrochem j.v..

text.p: Qatar on Sunday signed an agreement in principle with Phillips Petroleum Co of the United States to set up a $750 million petrochemical complex, Oil Minister Abdullah bin Hamad al-Attiyah said.

The state's Qatar General Petroleum Corp will hold 51 percent and Phillips 49 percent in the joint venture designed to produce 500,000 tonnes a year of ethylene and 467,000 tonnes a year of polyethylene, including high-density polyethylene (HDPE) and linear low-density polyethylene from 2000, he said.
The project also includes a Hexene-1 plant with a capacity of 50,000 tonnes annually.
The agreement was signed by Attiyah and Phillips chairman and chief executive officer Wayne Allen.
